messages.message: Testing the "prompt" cleaning feature on uat. As soon as I start typing it says there's a bug.
cc @Serena @CJ
oh god
hm, :cannotreproduce: , can you tell me step-by-step what you did
also deleting a cleaning field caused it to happen again
hm ok
is this an old project?
step by step:
okay and clicking "prompt" gives the error? can you paste the logs?
then i try to write in "enter clean prompt" and error
i see
i also cannot reproduce :disappointed:
the logs would help; can you click "To report this issue" and paste the logs here/
ok one sec
ah, what's your browser version?

Browser: chrome, Version 101.0.0
URL: https://aihub.uat.instabase.com/hub/build/000df639-d263-4b3b-a999-c26b6f080c6a
okay, toSpliced was only added to chrome in version 110 https://caniuse.com/mdn-javascript_builtins_array_tospliced so this is an outdated browser issue i think
hmm we definitely shouldn’t use utils from such a new version of chrome
chrome 101 came out may 2022
i think our webpack targets browsers within last two versions?
@Will McDermott you haven’t updated your chrome in a year and a half?!
in babel.config.json, `"browsers": ["last 2 versions"]`
well our users will definitely be on older versions than that :cry:  (and not just will)
yep def agree, it’s just interesting to see how the other side lives :joy:
but when do you stop supporting an old browser? there's other differences that can't be dealt with by webpack, like css and such
:face_with_cowboy_hat:

yes we need to make a wider decision on the minimum browser version we support, but for now, i think we should fix the current `toSpliced` issue by either (1) changing the browser targets in babel.config.json or (2) not using `toSpliced` in our code
we can start a separate thread on what minimum browser version to support in <#CSY11CK7T|>
old man on computer
so we can replace `"last 2 versions"` with `"cover 99.5%, not dead"`, for example. but the concern would be how this increases bundle size. i'll do some benchmarks
@Will McDermott unrelated but reminded me of this video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4HhPK8XC75A&t=365s)

Hey -- for now, it's fine as in don't change the implementation to support old chrome version yet (doesn't mean I won't ask us to do it, but don't do it now -- before we do that it's on Shaunak and me to first align with the field on how many older versions we should support :slightly_smiling_face: otherwise it's hard to implement). @Will McDermott -- update your chrome and see if the issue goes away? And @CJ -- can you quickly work with docs cc @jean to put the supported browser version into a proper section in the docs?

in other words, document the current state first :slightly_smiling_face: make changes later (i'll look for suggestions from the frontend team too as to what is reasonable & executable -- will follow up in the frontend channel)
btw our emojis are getting more and more creative.... i like :rootcaused:  haha
with `"last 2 versions"`, our supported browsers will always be the latest and second-latest versions of {Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Opera, Safari}
:thank_you: let's put that into the docs
we’ll get it added but also I’m shook rn about people not updating browsers :lol-sob:
